alert.note: Alert for Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued March 22 at 1:05AM AKDT until March 23 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Expect wind chills to range from 25 below zero to 50 below zero. * WHERE...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...6 PM this evening to noon Wednesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty northeast winds will develop Wednesday producing low visibilities in blowing snow. Expect difficult travel conditions. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.
